newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks close shade up in high turnover.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks close shade up in high turnover.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed marginally higher in improved turnover amid widespread buying by local and foreign investors, brokers said.
The all share index closed 0.91 points up at 636.86. Price gains outnubmered losses by 24 to 16. Central Finance rose 2.50 to 242.50, Development Finance two rupees to 250.
"The slow upward movement of the index is likely to hold because growth is expected to improve in 1997," said Shafi Waheed, a trader at CDIC Sasoon Cumberbatch.
"Investors believe that things can only look up after the drought in 1996 which severely hit earnings," he said.
Turnover was 84.4 million rupees on six million shares. The main trades were 1.5 million Distilleries Co, 1.2 million Asia Capital, 80,000 Hayleys, 769,500 Lanka Cement.
"Turnover would have been higher if sellers had not been stubborn," said Subram Ramaswamy of brokerage Bartleet Mallory.
Sellers were waiting in the hope that the recent election victory by the government and a cut in reserve ratios will boost share prices, he said.
The Central Bank slashed reserve ratios by two percent to 12 percent on Monday, on top of a cut of one percent in January to reduce corporate borrowing costs.--Prithi Kodagoda (941) 434319
